summary: Email chain from July 2021 between a federal prosecutor and FedEx legal staff regarding identifying a records custodian to authenticate FedEx records from 2008 for use in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. The records relate to a 2008 subpoena from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Tracy Chapell
persons.role: Senior Paralegal at Federal Express Corporation Legal Department
persons.context: FedEx legal staff member corresponding with federal prosecutors about authenticating 2008 FedEx records for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the upcoming trial in New York in November 2021 for which the FedEx records are being authenticated.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced by Tracy Chapell in an email asking if the records pertain to 'the' Jeffrey Epstein case.

persons.name: Tracy Ferrara
persons.context: Identified as the FedEx point of contact who handled a subpoena from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida in February 2008.

connections.description: Maxwell's trial is related to the Epstein investigation, and the records being sought are from the 2008 Epstein subpoena.
Chapell, as FedEx legal staff, is assisting prosecutors in authenticating records for use in Maxwell's trial.

events.title: Subpoena to FedEx in Epstein investigation
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida sent a subpoena to FedEx as part of the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.

events.title: Scheduled Ghislaine Maxwell trial
events.description: Trial for Ghislaine Maxwell scheduled to start in New York in November 2021.

events.title: Prosecution seeks records custodian for Maxwell trial
events.description: Federal prosecutors from the Southern District of New York contact FedEx to identify a records custodian to authenticate 2008 FedEx records for use in the Maxwell trial.

locations: 1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: In February 2008, the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida subpoenaed FedEx records as part of the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.
In July 2021, federal prosecutors from the Southern District of New York were preparing for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial by authenticating those 2008 FedEx records.
The FedEx point of contact for the 2008 subpoena was Tracy Ferrara.
The email chain shows coordination between law enforcement and corporate legal departments to secure trial evidence years after the initial investigation.
A FedEx paralegal explicitly asked if the records pertained to 'the' Jeffrey Epstein, indicating the notoriety of the case.
